Reviews.Title: “A great option for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: kylekylekyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011 after getting a great deal for 4 nights online. Staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms clean and some really nice shops and restaurants in the area. If you're staying for a few days then make sure you buy a travel card for the vaporetto as it works out much cheaper! Can't say anything bad about this hotel at all, I would say though that they do not have an iron so take a travel one with you! (and let them know if you're staying out until the early hours of the morning as the reception does close and you may have to wake somebody up...oops we are sorry!!) I will be recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to see Venice but avoid the overpriced side of things.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, too far from Venice”
Reviews.Author: sugary_unicorn
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, a quiet hotel half way up the main road in Lido (none of the locals seem to be able to give good direction to it though). We stayed in a double room for â‚¬50 a night, nice big rooms with en suite and itâ€™s a 2 min walk from the local supermarket (not that they have a kitchen for you to use) you can however pay an additional â‚¬5 per person for the breakfast which we chose to pass on. Overall it was a pleasant stay but the hotel lacks personality, you also have to take into consideration that will have to pay $6.50 for the water bus into Venice everyday (or buy a 3 or 5 day water bus pass for around â‚¬30 to â‚¬50)

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, nothing special though”
Reviews.Author: trimess
Reviews.Content: I think a lot of your opinion of this hotel will be determined by whether you had a room facing the street or not. We did and did not have the best stay here. The room was really warm, even with the provided fan, and we couldn't close the windows at all, due to the heat, allowing the streetlights (which are pointed up for some reason) to illuminate the room something fierce. The location was good, with Lido being a much more inexpensive option than Venice (with better priced restaurants), but only a short ferry ride away. Also a short walk to the beach in the other direction. The hotel was clean and had good WiFi in the lobby. PS. try the restaurant almost below the Hotel, great food at decent prices. We would probably stay there again, but this hotel is definitely better in the cooler months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MartynG_11
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews on this place which suggested basic. Indeed it is but I found staying here a really nice experience. Very clean room at the back of the hotel not overlooking the Santa Maria Elisabetta was super quiet. I enjoyed the free wireless downstairs in the lobby area. No A/C but a large fan in the room made things just fine. All of the staff I encountered were personable and friendly. I would definitely go back as with anywhere you are made to feel welcome you tend to remember.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I ever stayed in my life”
Reviews.Author: accmaia
Reviews.Content: The hotel employee rented my room to another guest, because I arrived "late" at the hotel. He charged me for the room, but rented it to the guest who arrived first, receiving twice for the same room. In order to not sleep on the street, I had to accept a employees room, which was dirty, nasty, with the sheets already used (I slept on my bath towel), but paying the same amount for it, like a regular room. In addition, the hotel is not located in Venice, not really. The hotel is situated in Lido, and is necessary to take a boat taxi that takes a long time to get to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Balance - excellent location & value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: softscoop
Reviews.Content: We got back last night from a week staying at this hotel!! After reading the reviews we were a little worried, but with no need what so ever! To get to the hotel was easy! We booked the water bus straight from the airport from Lido, this cost 15euros each, but was definitely worth it as I think this was the best possible way to arrive! (Try and get seats outside at the back of the boat, this way you can see everything appraoching!) We arrived at Lido and it was just a 5 minute walk up the main street! Our hotel room was lovely, we were on the top floor. From what I can see there were only 2 rooms like ours. Can't remember which number the room opposite was, but ours was 311. We couldn't open the windows, but soon worked out it was because we had an air conditioning unit in our room on constantly. This was a god send!! Our room was very spacious (a double bed & a single, wardrobe, 2 bedside tables, chest of draws, desk with a cupboard and a tv. Bathroom was big as well, shower, toilet, beday, sink & mirror) it was a bit rough around the edges, but we had fresh towels and our bed changed every day! The only draw back was there was no lift, so we had 4 flights of stairs to climb. This didn't really bother us, as we were eating so much food we probably needed the extra exercise!! We saw into the other rooms briefly (walking down the stairs passed as they were being cleaned), I can't comment on these really. They all had large windows with shutters, but looked slightly smaller than ours. Still would be perfectly acceptable for the price of this hotel considering its perfect location. Lido is beautiful, we were so thankful we stayed here rather than in Venice itself. Venice is very easy to get to though, the waterbus runs what seems like every 5/10mins and it goes 24 hours a day. No trouble. We bought a week travel pass for 53euros, which included our transfer back to the airport. (waterbus to p. roma and then no.5 bus to the airport). There is glorious beaches all along Lido, and it was perfect to come back to after being in the hustle and bustle of Venice for a couple of hours. We hired a 2 person bike one day and found an even nicer beach on the left hand tip of the island (as you look at it from Venice). The water was very clear here, with hardly any people and 2 gorgeous beach bars leading onto it. I think you can catch the bus here from just side the hotel. Unfortunately we only found it the day before going home and didn't have time to go back here for a day. Loads of places to eat and drink along the street the hotel is on, its location was actually pretty central. There is a supermarket up to the right, on the way to the waterbus stop. We didn't eat breakfast here, it was an extra 5euros per person per day, we found a little bar up the street opposite the supermarket called 'Bounty Bar'. They were very friendly here, and we had a couple of croissants or pastries each a day, which some coffee and water and cost us about 8euros all together. All in all a perfect holiday!! One I won't be forgetting in a while! Would recommend the hotel to anyone on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: faisal_latif
Reviews.Content: hey this is faisal from Dubai. Well the reason i got this hotel was primarily due to very cheap price 34euros a night. The good points was the ferry connection was jst 10 mins walking distance. u can excess entire venice thru this ferry network so lots of saving on your travel budget. The beds and rooms were nice and confortable. with powerful shower. the room seems to be renovated one. all in all a very good stay with this price. The Uncle sam on the reception was very friendly and seems to know veyr good english. the lido beach is jst ten minutes fromt this hotel and i heard this is the only beach in Venice. It is quite and nice romatic location where you woul like to spend vacation with your loved ones. But trust me guys 2 days are more then enough for touring entire venice. Minus points is that here are no lift in this hotel. Internet is not working above first floor but works very good in the reception area and first floor. Bathroom is small and the comode and wash basin are quite old too. but Cleaniness of bathroom and the entire room is very very good. Bed Bugs as mentioned by one of thr traveller is totally UNTRUE as i cheaked my bed entirely before checking in. Over all i will rate this hotel as 7/10...lets say good value for money. if you are tigth on budget pls go for this Hotel you will not regret for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs - BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: balkan_bidaiari
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a week. Although cheap, the rooms are tiny, the employees are not particularly nice, the free-internet is not available from the rooms, and, more importantly: there are BED BUGS. One of my worst hotel-experiences ever. The location is great, though. Right in Lido's main street, SME, 5 min walk from the vaporetto terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...okay place”
Reviews.Author: Max1002
Reviews.Content: We loved staying on Lido. The hotel was really close to the vaparatto and walking distance to the beach and many restaurants. The room however was just okay. It was very large and seemed clean. The lack of an elevator and air conditioning made it a little rough coming home to. However, we visited during high season and the price was just a 100 euro a night. We were a little uncomfortable leaving our keys when we went out because the front desk was often unmanned and you just grabbed your key on the way back to your room. The staff was friendly and spoke some English. Breakfast was not much, one kind of cereal, rolls, and prepackaged cookies. It was nice to have WiFi, however it only works in the lobby area. I wouldn't NOT stay here again, but if we go back to Venice I would continue to look for something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, Budget Option in great Neighbourhood on Lido”
Reviews.Author: wanda79
Reviews.Content: Simple, Clean, Budget Hotel. Great location on the lido in lovely bustling neighbourhood. 5 mins from vaporetto and 15- 20 mins journey to st marks square. We didnt have breakfast. Its a basic hotel but if all your looking for is a clean bed in a nice safe area its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Two words: BED BUGS.”
Reviews.Author: danni1990
Reviews.Content: First impressions walking into the "lobby", a seedy old man sitting behind a counter. No computer, just notepads. Then, I had to drag my luggage up the stairs (no lifts). We reached our room, and had to use actual keys to open our door, which took us about 5 minutes and a whole look of jimmying to be able to get it to unlock. After opening the door, we were greeted by a strange, bleach kind of smell. Bathroom was clean which was nice. Room was very old. It had a tiny analogue tv with a remote that didn't work. The bed was old, and was actually two singles pushed together with a double sheet over it. After the second night of sleeping, though, I woke up with red bites all over my body. It seems I was attacked by bed bugs. This was not acceptable. I would not recommended this hotel to anyone. Also, most of the time there was no one at reception. On their website they advertise a buffet breakfast, I never saw anything of the sort. Nor was there internet access like described also. Not worth the money spent, even if it was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “recommend to those who don't want to spend lots of money”
Reviews.Author: zelenskya
Reviews.Content: Room: very small, with old furniture but clean. no problems with hot&cold water. no problems with reservation, check-in/out, etc. Location: the street is rather noisy (e.g. buses) but it's ok in general. it takes 5-10 minutes to get to vaporetto by foot. it takes approximately 10 minutes to get to the main island by vaporetto. with 72h ticket it's not a problem to live on Lido. Lido in general wonderful place to walk and live, with fresh air & lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “good if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: beccalee
Reviews.Content: venice is an expensive place to stay. as two backpackers it was the best deal we could find. its a bit of a long boat ride from the main tourist spots which is a pain but we had a good nights sleep staying in lido as it is quiter. on the upside the beach is a ten minute walk away. hotel was decent. ensuite bathroom seemed new and refurbished. room was a bit old and musty with large damp spot on ceiling. however for the price we were paying it served its purpose. comfy bed with no bed bugs and clean bathroom. can't really ask for more :) supermarket is down the road, staff i met were pleasant and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent, but Unimpressionable, Place”
Reviews.Author: sadseh
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend here from April 9 to 11. Provided you're fine with Lido and the 6.50 euro ferry fee you'll be paying each time you want to leave (or not, somehow I don't think anyone ever checks if you paid to board), the location is quite good. Lido seems to have a "main" street extending from the ferry stop to the beach across the island where the grocery store and all the restaurants and tourist shops are. Reiter is conveniently located roughly half-way down this street. Upon arrival, we were notified that our double room was unavailable for the first of the two nights, and that they could either offer a much smaller room with two single beds for 10 euros less than we ordered, or we could get a regular double at a sister hotel elsewhere on Lido. Wary of sister hotels, we opted for the first option, landing what I think was 203. As promised, the room is ridiculously small, coupled with an absurd amount of bulky furniture. The combination of both factors meant we had to stuff our luggage into the closet, and move the table and dressers around as if we were playing "Parking Garage" whenever we wanted to open the balcony/window. The second night, however, we were offered a much more spacious room with three beds at our original rate as compensation--307 I think. Both rooms were adequately clean and tidy, though they had water/fungus stains around some ceiling corners. We had some moths flap around our pillow in the second room, as well, so I would not be surprised if bugs become an issue as the summer goes on. The electrical wiring also seems a bit hazardous, with the sockets shakily sticking out exposed from the wall. The bathrooms were clean and roomy, however, with all the standard amenities like towels, soap, shampoo, etc. Water was hot in the first room early in the morning; in the second room, by 10 AM, it would not exceed lukewarm. Because we changed rooms each night, we did not get to see how well room service took care of used sheets and towels. Each room gets a TV, but no fridge, and food is not allowed into the room. The balconies are also a nice touch, provided you can access them. Decoration is plain, sparse, and very inconspicuous. In short, a decent place for sleeping, but I wouldn't want to spend any time of my day in there--what you'd expect of a decent hostel. The staff appear friendly enough, though their English is limited. They're helpful enough to let you use their dining hall utensils and tables for eating your own food during the day, but not enough to tip you off to a good restaurant or local price range. Maybe they're much better if you can, or at least try to, speak Italian. Didn't try their breakfast (for which you have to pay). No lift. All in all, there's nothing terribly wrong with this place (aside from having ridiculously small rooms directly across from the stairwell), but nothing endearing either. Expect this to be more of a good hostel than a hotel, and you won't be disappointed. The price could be cheaper for what you get, though. I realize Venice is expensive, but so is Rome, and we grabbed a much better place there for the same price (Alice in Wonderland). Especially when you consider that this is Lido, a ferry ride away from mainland Venice and with a bland continental atmosphere (no Venice charm here), I think they should be offering either a better rate or better amenities. But all in all, I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “too bad....”
Reviews.Author: beenay25
Reviews.Content: despite the comfortable location if you wanna be located at Lido and the overall cleanliness of the room this hotel could be much, much better....the main problem with our stay was the staff: very unhelpful. The impression of being considered as a disposable, slightly annoing useless costumers never left us as anything we asked just seemed to be a good reason for an eyes-roll and a "no". Having said that the rooms are poorely furnished but clean (at least our was), the bed was ok and bathroom is very small with hot water that tends to run out mid morning if the hotel is full...no breakfast included in a price that should have been 30% cheaper to raise the overall experience.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: at the moment, London, formaly NZ
Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are of a budget.”
Reviews.Author: missmandapants
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for the Carnival in Febuary 2009. We left it a little late booking a place to stay, and because the Carnival is the busiest time of the year in Venice everything is more expensive than normal. Although it was a little more than we would have liked to pay for what we got, thats pretty much the norm when you are looking for something around carnival time, even if you do book further in advance but it was ok. Hotel Reiter is on Lido which is about 20 mins away from the main islands by water bus, and about 5 mins walk from the Hotel, to the water bus stop. We stayed in room 108 on the 1st floor. Walls are pretty thin, so we could hear people coming and going (our room was right by the staircase) so if you were a light sleeper maybe you could request a room further away from foot traffic. The room was basic, but had everything we needed. Good heating, queen sized bed, hand towles, bath towels, and floor towl (although we didn't have a face cloth, no biggie though). Ensuit bathroom, small but fine for what we needed. High water pressure in shower, toilet, sink, hair drier. The water tank must have run out the first day, and I got a cold shower, but I had left it untill late in the morning, so I must have been one of the last to have shower and all the hot water was gone. The manager is very nice, and helpful. Pointing out places to go etc. We didn't bring the right plug adaptour with us, but he loaned us one to use. There was no fridge or sink, so its a good idea to buy a few plastic bowls and cutlery if you want to save a bit of money by not eating out all the time. There is a super market about 3 mins walk down from the Hotel Lido is a good location. Being slightly away from the main island, its a bit cheaper, but it doesn't take very long to get to the main islands. If you are on a budget as we were I would recoment eating at Lido as much as you can rather than the main island. We worked out that on average most things are about 5 euros cheaper per dish, so if you were having a starter plus main or dessert you could be saving up to around 20-30 euros for the whole meal for two people. There is a great place just down from Hotel Rieter but I can't remember the name of it! Cheap, clean, basic, would recomend to a friend on a budget, and we would stay there again if we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vfm”
Reviews.Author: LisaLoverofItaly
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here for my sister's birthday in a spacious, clean room - much better than a lot of hotels I have stayed in in Italy that cost an awful lot more. The staff were friendly without being in your face and I certainly had no complaints. Venice has become frightfully expensive and the Lido is that little bit better value for money and that makes all the difference. So easy to get to St Mark's - we enjoyed our twice daily trip across the lagoon. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday ruined by nasty manager”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysRain82
Reviews.Content: Ignoring the damp that spread from the bottom of the wall to the ceiling, the room was clean and spacious and we were happy. On the last night I turned the key in the door to lock our room and it snapped off in my hand. I politely approached the night manager to ask for assistance and he became immediately aggressive, accusing me of putting too much pressure on the key and that I had to pay for it. The debate became heated and the manager then threatened my boyfriend before calling the police and swearing at us. Having left us for 15mins he then cancelled the police call and returned with a maintenance man who fixed a new lock within minutes and seemed to be saying that the fault was with the lock, not the pressure put on the key (I didn't put any on it!) After a traumatic evening of upset we received no apology and the experience left a bitter stamp on the end of an otherwise perfect holiday. I resent the manager for ruining our last night and speaking to me with a complete lack of respect, something I am not accustomed to. I would NEVER visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: OscarVII
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews here before we went and, frankly, now wonder what on earth some people expect for their money. Our room was clean, everything worked, the bed was comfortable. The location is good, being close to an excellent bar/coffee shop and near some reasonable restaurants. There is a small supermarket just up the road. It takes about five minutes to walk to the vaporetti stops, a little longer to get to the beach. Costs are very reasonable, so don't expect air-conditioning (the fan in your room is a fair substitute - and we were there in late July, with temperatures well over 30) or a lift. There will be noise from the street in the evening if your room is at the front and hot weather necessitates opening the windows, though it dies down by midnight. The Lido is a good base from which to explore Venice and the other islands in the lagoon. Your approach to La Serenissima is the traditional breath-taking water-route past the Doge's Palace if you choose vaporetto Route No 1; you can retreat to the comparative calm of the Lido when the crowds and heat in the city get too much to bear. And things generally are much cheaper on the Lido, especially food and drink. Be sure to eat at least once at the Trattoria Africa di Diana Daniela & C., a few blocks to the south of the main street (the Gran Viale). Their pasta parcels with pears and two cheeses is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “It's less expensive for a reason”
Reviews.Author: jerrocop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel 3 nights. It was a welcome respite from the crowds in Venice and I would definately recommend staying on Lido rather than Venice. However, this Hotel has seen better days and is in need of an update and modernization. There was no Air-Conditioning which seems to be pretty typical of hotels in this category. In July it was hot and humid but we were able to get a good breeze from the very large windows. The floors are vinyl tile and the bathroom was clean but just barely. Breakfasts were minimal and not a lot of food was available. If you are on a budget then this may be your best option but don't expect much. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Venice is a quick boat ride (15min) and will take you to any of the usual stops. The atmosphere is more relaxed in Lido and there is a nightlife but not as elaborate or buisy as Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, not so sure about secure”
Reviews.Author: Harry_Berry
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Reiter around 11 am. We expected to store our bags and come back at 1400 to check-in, but the gentleman at the desk allowed us to check in early, which was a plus. The downside, however, was that the available room was on the front side of the hotel, which I'd read in other reviews is quite noisy - and it was. One concern I had was when we returned later that evening. No one was at the desk so we looked in the next room and saw a lady cleaning. We stood there awhile and finally she acnowledged us. We said we'd like our key and she said "grab it". Not only was this rude, but totally unsecure as we (or anyone else) could grab any key we wanted. While I have to admit that we had nothing stolen during our stay, it was a nagging concern in the back of my mind the entire time. I still rate the hotel above average because it was clean and cheap, the breakfast wasn't bad, and after all, maybe all venice hotels are lax on security. Bring earplugs or get a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel in Lido, a boat ride from Venice”
Reviews.Author: suluu
Reviews.Content: Just like other reviewers said, it was just a fine boat ride from central Venice by vaporetto. If you get the 72 hr. transportation card, all public transport is included. Lido is a perfect place for those wanting to get away from all the hustle and bustle of a tourist core. The hotel is located on the main drag, just about 3 blocks from the vaporetto station (no hills on the island). It was nice because you can reserve online and pay via credit card. also includes a private bathroom which is a gem in budget accommodations in Europe. The hotel doesn't have a lift, so be prepared to lift you own luggage up the stairs. They only have 1 hair dryer, so you have to borrow it from the front desk when you want to use it - no problem. Breakfast was effecient (included), of fresh rolls with hazelnut spread (Nutella imitation that was fine). The coffee is despensed out of one of those nescafe machines, which is mas o menos. a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Irish group in Hotel Reiter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of 15 Conamara people syed at Hotel Reiter on the May Bank Holiday weekend. Everyone in the group found the hotel a nice place to stay. It is unpretensious but friendly and comfortable. The manager (Fabio) was very flexible and accomodating, as we needed to make some changes in types of rooms, from singles to doubles etc. The location is great. The Lido itself is a very nice place, completely different to Venezia. Overall we would recommend it to anyone......unless you are a bit of a fusser and have nothing to do with your time but go on the internet. Beidh muid ar ais. GearÃ³id Ã“ MurchÃº, IndreabhÃ¡n, Conamara, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price - suitable for Gay couples as well”
Reviews.Author: LindseyM
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have just returned from Venice and had a great time! The Hotel Reiter was lovely, especially considering how cheap it was. When we asked for a double room, the smiley guy at the desk asked, "United or seperate?" which was quite funny. We actually got a quad room so the bathroom was lovely and big - i'd stay there again just for the power shower!! We got stung when we first arrived off the bus from the airport as we followed a crowd and ended up on a private boat over to San Marco. You need to go to the ACTV water bus station which is behind the auto bus station to get the public bus - its a lot cheaper and if you get the 51 or 52 bus, will take you straight to Lido. There is a nice bar in Lido called Star People and the owner, Luca is lovely (if you go, say Hi from Lindsey and Jo) - we went there every night. Its just around the corner from the hotel (ask for the Chinese and you'll find it there). All in all, a really lovely stay and would highly recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: soontobebrown
Reviews.Content: Plus points - good location close to Vaporetta stop. Ten minutes by boat to the Grand Canal and St Mark's Square. Excellent directions and travel details given on the Venere website. Reasonable prices for Venice. Friendly, helpful staff. Good breakfast. Minus points - Mould on ceiling of bathroom. Hot - no air conditioning, although a table fan is provided. Our room was noisy - there is an amusement arcade next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - nothing wrong with it!”
Reviews.Author: westie04
Reviews.Content: Me and my cousin stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Rooms were clean and spacious. I couldn't believe how pleasant it was because it was such a reasonable price! And an extra bonus for us - because we were on the top floor, we had air conditioning! But beware, there are only 2 rooms in the whole place with air con - we were lucky. Breakfast was fine. Internet stations didn't work, bar one. But it was great to have free internet access in our hotel! It was only a short, pleasant ride away from Venice. In fact, it was nice to be away from the huge crowds in the evenings. And of course the beach is very near to this hotel, at the end of the road! Compared to the other hotels we'd stayed in which were the same price, this hotel is excellent! Would definitely reccommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Reiter Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta 57-B | Lido, 30126 Venice, Italy
